this time it's Egypt versus Israel both
sides are model as equally willing to
fight and there is no help from either
sides allies nor any trade embargoes two
longtime enemies going at each other one
more time what has changed since the
last war in 1973 Egypt enjoyed some
early success against Israel but
ultimately lost after a short war Israel
proved back then it could mobilize its
reserves within days while Egypt had a
sluggish mobilization process to keep
the attack a surprise attackers did not
mobilize all of their army numbers back
then were more in Israel's favor when it
comes to balance of numbers Egypt shed
more of its forces since the 1973 war
and strived for a more professional
force Israel currently has less active
soldiers and more of them are conscripts
however their troops have more
experience overall and trained more
often Ezreal does lack greatly in
overall numbers when paramilitary is
included air forces will scramble
quickly in this area Israel holds the
technological advantage as Egypt does
not have political access to certain key
weapons Israel has a more capable
fighter force it would reign invincible
over its homeland Egypt has more dual
role planes and thus numbers overall but
over a neutral terrain without its air
defenses it would quickly lose numerical
superiority Egypt's big strength would
be layered air defenses today there
perhaps even more capable for their time
than they were in 73 Israel would have
serious problems attacking Egyptian air
bases in this scenario where pre-emptive

also possesses force multiplayer
platforms like a wax which would make

than in the past
still Israeli standoff missiles which
Egypt lags in would tie part of their

ballistic missiles but they're not
precision-guided Israel also enjoys

blunting Egyptian attacks strikes an
airbase
would continue and would be blunted only
by sheer numbers of Egyptian air
defenses Israel may lose planes too

Israeli Air Force and air defenses a big

disadvantage when it comes to
surveillance
Israel has recon satellite fleet with

while larger features fairly old ships
their assault ship fleet would be mostly

the two large Mistral ships could serve

could ferry troops around Sinai Israeli
Navy is mostly based in the

Force can be avoided it would be too

Israel Egyptian Navy could also somewhat

their ships having half-decent area air
defense systems
indeed best use of whole Egyptian Navy
would be to harass this nigh coastline
and alongside the air force and air
defenses tying Israel's own air force
into dealing with them unlike in 1973
Egypt controls the Sinai Peninsula but

Egyptian military presence there it's a

Canal Israel would use all its might to

make it easier today but trucking
countless
makeshift crossings from the air is

systems the biggest difference in

the fighting would happen there
concentrating so many troops on such a

Ezreal has an advantage there but Egypt

would likely play defense with their
ground army Egypt who need to try and

besides the landings around South Sinai
lighter infantry units would likely take

hoping to fully utilize the width of the
Senate front and enable Egypt to utilize

Egyptian army is not as motorized as

accounted for Egypt to rise a lot on
indigenous armored truck designs to
ferry its troops such wheeled platforms
may have issues over the desert terrain
Israeli platforms lack organic firepower
as most are simple personnel carriers
and majority of them are old US designs
Egypt has over twice as many artillery
pieces towed pieces would be riskier to

Egypt might try and wait until its
forces crossing the mountains are in
position before making a serious bush

without them superior Israeli precision

American superiority Israel lacks

rushing means air defenses could not be

other countries would get involved and

cannot match the aid israel can get

catching up with Israeli that also shows

they would also put pressure

Egypt could produce armored vehicles and
has some maintenance facilities Egypt

of Israel might see casualties further

lines being left with mostly infantry
Egypt would find it hard to advance
further into urban areas and it might
even start losing ground if it had no
constant influx of additional manpower
and purchased new hardware to match
Israeli purchases with all that in mind
it would be both sides bloodiest war yet
final verdict in such a hypothetical
total war scenario Egypt may actually
achieves some sort of victory however
none of this took into account Israeli
nuclear arsenal which is considerable
Egyptian anti-ballistic missile system
isn't designed against the kind of
missiles Israel would use and sheer
number of warheads and delivery
platforms would mean at least half of
them would get detonated
faced with a hundred detonated nukes and
their industrial centers military bases
and large army formations Egypt's
military potential would diminish
greatly flat terrain would also be quite
conducive to damage it is plausible
dozens of divisions might be neutralized

heavy industry using nukes at the start

Egyptian high-end hardware and enable
Israel to use its air forces to
patiently pick up the remains of
Egyptian forces from afar in the end
Israel will be the clear winner with
